title: Why Not Normal?
question_text: At a local company, the mean salary for all employees is $\$58{,}020$ and the standard deviation is $\$19{,}694$ . An individual making $\$140{,}396$ while working at this company would be in the $95^\text{th}\text{ percentile}$ while an individual in the $25^\text{th}\text{ percentile}$ would be making about $\$44{,}735$ . Which of the following reasons might cause us to suspect that the distribution of salaries at this company is not approximately normal?

choices.text: The difference between the 95 th percentile 95 th percentile and the mean is greater than the difference between the mean and the 25 th percentile 25 th percentile .
If the salaries were normally distributed, we would expect an individual making $ 140,396 $ 140,396 to be in a percentile higher than the 95 th 95 th .
If the salaries were normally distributed, someone at the 95 th percentile 95 th percentile should be making more than $ 140,396 $ 140,396 .
If the salaries were normally distributed, someone at the 25 th percentile 25 th percentile should be making less than $ 44,735 $ 44,735 .
All of the above are valid reasons why we may suspect the distribution is not approximately normal.
